document.title: Alabama Course of Study: English Language Arts

5F9E960AF92143E4855D183F4E89E3BE.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts.

95EDFAFA31354BDDB141E821EB30035D.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the same general action (e.g., walk, march, strut, prance) by acting out the meanings.

0168E253243747CE9BD5BE650A3B61EA.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at school that are colorful).

BD0E65662C88436C976721AEB4C0DF32.description: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites (antonyms).

A0FB703EF7894D0C835E733F69F7FAA3.description: Sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

64F3DB08D23B4733A7BC0DB94B19A46B.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

D0B83F19B27340CFB4615600C5951738.description: Use the most frequently occurring inflections and affixes (e.g., -ed, -s, re-, un-, pre-, -ful, -less) as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word.

E4899571C3F943B7B911EBEF69217900.description: Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (e.g., knowing duck is a bird and learning the verb to duck).

A04CC9CE3A084552901220348D2034BB.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on kindergarten reading and content.

0976375E28134150BE87A6863BBD3326.description: Spell simple words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of sound-letter relationships.

D215433525DA4971962D7B483BAC1A35.description: Write a letter or letters for most consonant and short-vowel sounds (phonemes).

CAF7C053DAB84F56B57C24B487BD72C5.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

9CADFFEA3FAB4D408D9412667D76C01A.description: Begin to develop command of the conventions of Standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

15367EFD10EF4A8682D4377B30417F8B.description: Produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

9A8DC9F6F7BD4FB190854203902DC6A7.description: Use the most frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., to, from, in, out, on, off, for, of, by, with).

408DA2C6B3CB419B9A312DD39068B523.description: Understand and use question words (interrogatives) (e.g., who, what, where, when, why, how).

B369E17102B041DFBB322512E99FBCDF.description: Form regular plural nouns orally by adding /s/ or /es/ (e.g., dog, dogs; wish, wishes).

A32F3BD05B3448D0A02F5536F5ABB7AB.description: Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs.

6BCCADB4080B49E08DB6CC8F85D15975.description: Print many uppercase and lowercase letters.

0C3686503EB448AFAAF9B4449163EC08.description: Begin to demonstrate command of the conventions of Standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

E67FEEBC29E14615837C1E1725BDE9FD.description: Speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

37C6009148C84A329C0BC818E12443A8.description: Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions as desired to provide additional detail.

E3D59FDE5A434E759F49D700370FC2C3.description: Describe familiar people, places, things, and events and, with prompting and support, provide additional detail.

A6BA31AB91894776B527C28B5D67C6A2.description: Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not understood.

541CCED1B9424CA99CA037BB6758FBB1.description: Confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media by asking and answering questions about key details and requesting clarification if something is not understood.

C824B9DF247A4F1096C91B4E1C672FC8.description: Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

F4658E1778AC40A0B92B7917D56FD4F9.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others and taking turns speaking about the topics and texts under discussion).

078D5E596BA24F54AD24DCDCB738C3F1.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about kindergarten topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

65764CC06AC6489FAA06713EF88F6CDA.description: With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

C44873EF28F3402A8BCD976F4572A8AE.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of books by a favorite author and express opinions about them).

BE7C83C148A5450EBA5C4B2BE14BF6F1.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

6214F8CADB1B41918986E3D2C77EDBDB.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.

6625AA9CCD4640D9B60E91290123857D.description: With guidance and support from adults, respond to questions and suggestions from peers and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

080447EC2E034AC8B3BA48410678C5BD.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to narrate a single event or several loosely linked events, tell about the events in the order in which they occurred, and provide a reaction to what happened.

4E3F1653371C448D84B3F92E26E1C4D1.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose informative or explanatory texts in which they name what they are writing about and supply some information about the topic.

7C9B53F8DB0547D2AD5E0F059B604426.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose opinion pieces in which they tell a reader the topic or the name of the book they are writing about and state an opinion or preference about the topic or book (e.g., My favorite book is . . .).

5A63221446754162B588C40AB8DC3038.description: Read emergent-reader texts with purpose and understanding.

7DDFD812C525400F9E69861FACCAB728.description: Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ.

E4AD8B3077F14E219206ED73AC145429.description: Read common high-frequency words by sight (e.g., the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does).

CC5CC941166C48DF926E18F8C0657BF7.description: Associate the long and short sounds with common spellings (graphemes) for the five major vowels.

C7C051D456EB42F7A3DAA1647C89749C.description: Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one letter-sound correspondences by producing the primary or many of the most frequent sounds for each consonant.

08821219CE2D4147B766B00298756AD6.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

57ED7BC203DA48D48C7673408D86B541.description: Add or substitute individual sounds (phonemes) in simple, one-syllable words to make new words.

23FC4A7C3B0C40A0A9484CBCB399BC8F.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in three-phoneme (consonant-vowel-consonant, or CVC) words. (This does not include CVCs ending with /l/, /r/, or /x/.) (Words, syllables, or phonemes written in /slashes/ refer to their pronunciation or phonology. Thus, /CVC/ is a word with three phonemes regardless of the number of letters in the spelling of the word.)

F17F4318C0144B9AAEA3E23E1B85B0AC.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

4660A18F267A4DF391DF1A4C954B3148.description: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

35BEB9CB5AFF4160BD1BB17D208487C9.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

3C11D9FB89DA40C28FC8D4B6F76EB3F1.description: Recognize and name all uppercase and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

DA037C432C85468588C40BEC312C7C64.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

27AFD83625A44983866273A253B2E277.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

91AB4C342FCA4BAD89F836AE226CB92E.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

DA06FD5084374FD9AB1B90E38E29BBCF.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

23AF81F0A9214B1FB9B69EC07C63D41A.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

5F4D95A5ABF64C77965AF7C99DB2A6D9.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

CE51454749A148CF8039197B1D8AF651.description: With prompting and support, identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

01D6EAE5D0AC42358E15C479B8563F02.description: With prompting and support, identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

0252B7391B264FB5A38A4AE1B111380F.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the text in which they appear (e.g., what person, place, thing, or idea in the text an illustration depicts).

06222045B1B04B74A0A2350D4DE67FA8.description: Name the author and illustrator of a text and define the role of each in presenting the ideas or information in a text.

C976649950654E1D9F06FCEE231AB287.description: Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

799F662DC47444568100BA39986BF396.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

4E55937FCA554842BC89692AA28A47B4.description: With prompting and support, describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

964D7FDA882C49B097982B0682F35FEB.description: With prompting and support, identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

5F3FB3DECAF947EF80556286A5EE7F8A.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

81424D16011F45638B864E2CFAC301CA.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

376BBFAF303B48B486907E23EE9F73DD.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

AD7514FE6D944D7C8CB618C71838A156.description: With prompting and support, compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in familiar stories.

832D7F2169454724BE3626665CA85EF7.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the story in which they appear (e.g., what moment in a story an illustration depicts).

C165B0F59A9942E99F867EB844B6438D.description: With prompting and support, name the author and illustrator of a story and define the role of each in telling the story.

5CDFB594F0D04ED88FB88A2B45F3AAB5.description: Recognize common types of texts (e.g., storybooks, poems).

22E8A0A5080E4061AAEA93C5916035CB.description: Ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

6A602D71F0A34C69AE3D1BA65E448DA9.description: With prompting and support, identify characters, settings, and major events in a story.

BB966D6ED23F45A2A52EDF0B0A8B96F7.description: With prompting and support, retell familiar stories, including key details.

F3C8E39DD6484BB2914134F3C0287088.description: Make predictions to determine main idea and anticipate an ending.

D5444DD4902F42789E1C16300C1EC3CE.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

7BF44BE7EF2140A5952F111E6584A15F.description: Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression

6230296079924A6497F890BBF4506E50.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

EBF1CABCC62D46BCAF227CE931B8E020.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

C5332CD0562749A29A338FFFBEFC16AA.description: Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.

EAAE8CAEA403497683DAE7911293D7F5.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of Standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

430C7C75B7644303A74FF80F460D4647.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of Standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

A0F4EE9652494C2A99496DE673C0BD85.description: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Language

1BF04E9DF2154848BCC3EC24D823CEA5.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and communicative tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.

4B6A41CB8ED249099993F32CC74D0E79.description: Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance understanding of presentations.

0C781201B33B408E8659B01343B0C744.description: Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

A5864813BF7C42A6A3D2ACD32D8540E1.description: Evaluate a speaker's point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric.

82F6D2BA0C50437F852DD57EDA4AE670.description: Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

5E3ABB2586234BFB822148F55CCDB97D.description: Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

E5A46741F4294C919DD93E17FE13CCE6.description: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Speaking and Listening

93A7AEA14A04408B9A23C734524F783E.description: Write routinely over extended time frames, including time for research, reflection, and revision, and shorter time frames such as a single sitting or a day or two for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

3CE3D1CBE8B44A1792ED7A3E20CDD235.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

420656A96B4148B397932E7917DAC38C.description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.

D79424B5651D4394AD36D52E92E4F8BD.description: Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

68517799E18A4325865F3E61D0E8491E.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

25306D45B7F846ECA852BAF7BFDAC026.description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

4921B36129F54078AAA15AFDF1D6A49B.description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.

A10686E2CF2E4FFE823463983D9B1DB7.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

4DF060B7CBFD42B28FFD47C9063D1E89.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences.

3086000732AC4938A6C1B90BB221DFB5.description: Write informative or explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

0D8347D786EB42EF9032CD876CC316C3.description: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence.

8FDA250FBD684EF98ED6D309D12ADA55.description: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing

9AE2ECEDD37940ABBDA552D6C3D70374.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

F82FE29B19AB4A1186C3AEFEF7C9FB4E.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

94A4C84878B944069D3BC6411F022805.description: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.

25B7C9DA582544C88342F6AA0949670A.description: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

B9B847A091E34D2BB6F73B18C238100C.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse formats and media, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.

F7ED29CF2FD046128C4679E01321855F.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

0AAC7D87EBD74C6BAEAE0D84B48CBC6F.description: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

6AEE31BBE25D4D96A79534CC026935D6.description: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

2CCE648517ED42B3A1476AE08BDC9FC0.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

4C0AF31CEDEE4390B7203CB45D2FFD33.description: Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

76877CC987004277ACDA2B247F0C096F.description: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.

E3743A1861E54CA983B1C64DA87303AC.description: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading
